column4: does anyone have any hint or clue how I could fix "FATAL: module raid1 not found" ? I got the system to mount my RAID1 array from a liveCD but I'm not sure what's keeping it from booting
you are trying to load a RAID driver off a RAID array. see the problem?
Yes, but the RAID driver is compiled into the kernel and it was working fine, all I did was install ubuntu-desktop
so it boots completely but fails to load X?
No, I installed ubuntu-desktop and restarted (trying to switch from xfce to gnome) and it won't boot anymore
It goes to busybox after about 10 minutes
did your update include a new kernel and an initramfs rebuild?
Assuming there was a new kernel / initramfs, with my array mounted on a liveCD is there a way I can recompile the driver into the kernel?
there are some good tutorials on building your own kernel and initramfs
So I can do it from a LiveCD? that was what I was meaning to ask.
Can I set that to mount on boot?
Can I automount SFTP in fstab?
